principle.name: constructive_tone
principle.description: Maintain a positive, constructive tone throughout the review

guidelines.guideline: Focus on the code, not the person
Use "we" and "our" to foster collaboration
Avoid absolute terms like "always" and "never"
Recognize good practices and improvements

examples.good: "This approach is interesting. We might also consider..."

principle.name: specific_feedback
principle.description: Provide specific, actionable feedback with clear examples

guidelines.guideline: Reference specific lines or sections of code
Provide code examples for suggested improvements
Explain the impact of the issue
Suggest alternative approaches when appropriate

examples.good: "In the authentication middleware around line 45, the password validation doesn't include complexity checks. This could allow weak passwords. Consider adding: [code example]"

principle.name: balanced_perspective
principle.description: Balance criticism with recognition of good work

guidelines.guideline: Start with positive observations
Acknowledge the effort and intent behind the code
Recognize when code follows good patterns
End with encouragement and next steps

examples.good: "The error handling in this module is well implemented. I noticed one area for improvement in the authentication logic. Overall, this is a solid implementation that with a few tweaks will be even better."
examples.bad: "Here are all the problems with your code."

section.name: executive_summary
section.description: High-level overview of the review findings

content.item: Brief summary of what was reviewed

section.name: critical_issues
section.description: Issues that must be addressed immediately (Pareto 20%)

section.name: important_improvements
section.description: Issues that should be addressed soon

section.name: nice_to_have
section.description: Minor improvements that can be deferred

section.name: positive_aspects
section.description: What's working well and should be maintained

pattern.name: clarification_requests
pattern.description: How to ask for clarification without sounding critical

approach.step: Provide context for why understanding is important

examples.good: "I'm trying to understand the reasoning behind this implementation. Could you help me understand how this approach handles [specific scenario]?"
examples.bad: "This doesn't make sense. Why did you do it this way?"

pattern.name: suggesting_alternatives
pattern.description: How to suggest alternative approaches effectively

approach.step: Explain the benefits of the alternative
Emphasize this as a suggestion, not a requirement

examples.good: "The current implementation works well for the basic case. I wonder if we might also consider [alternative approach] which could provide [specific benefit]. Here's an example of how that might look: [code example]"
examples.bad: "You should do it this other way instead."

pattern.name: handling_disagreements
pattern.description: How to handle technical disagreements professionally

approach.step: Focus on objective criteria (performance, maintainability, etc.)
Know when to defer to team consensus or authority

examples.good: "I see your point about [their perspective]. From a maintainability standpoint, [alternative] might offer [specific benefits]. What are your thoughts on balancing these concerns?"
examples.bad: "My way is better because I said so."

consideration.name: experience_levels
consideration.description: Adapt communication based on the developer's experience level

guidelines.guideline: For junior developers: Provide more explanation and mentoring
For senior developers: Focus on collaborative problem-solving
Adjust technical depth based on audience
Always maintain respect regardless of experience

consideration.name: team_dynamics
consideration.description: Consider the team's established culture and processes

guidelines.guideline: Respect existing team conventions and patterns
Align with the team's definition of done
Consider the project's phase and constraints
Balance ideals with practical delivery needs

consideration.name: business_context
consideration.description: Consider the business constraints and priorities

guidelines.guideline: Understand the feature's business importance
Consider time-to-market constraints
Balance technical debt with delivery needs
Focus on value-delivering improvements

scenario.name: multiple_rounds
scenario.description: How to handle follow-up reviews after changes

approach.step: Focus on remaining issues using Pareto principle
Check if previous feedback was understood and addressed

scenario.name: disagreement_resolution
scenario.description: How to follow up when there's disagreement on feedback

approach.step: Suggest involving additional team members if needed
Know when to agree to disagree and move forward

scenario.name: implementation_help
scenario.description: How to offer help with implementing changes

approach.step: Offer specific assistance with complex changes
Respect the developer's ownership of the code
